result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Douglas Love Jr.

defendant.name: Love, James Douglas, Jr.
defendant.address: 3314 S Cty Rd D, Poplar, WI 54864

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:37 AM Defendant James Douglas Love Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for James Douglas Love Jr.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

3:16 PM Defendant James Douglas Love Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for James Douglas Love Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $2000 cash. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State notes defendant is currently on Extended Supervision and is on absconder status, currently has hold due to status. Recites defendants previous criminal history with 18 FTAs. Attorney Reid notes that defendant is on assistance and is lifelong resident with family in the area. Asks for $500 cash.
Court order $2000 cash. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:45 am.
